title: SCHOLZ AND FRIENDS LOGO
author: IZZYFOREVER

comments.content: Part of the ampersand, could be [Legacy Sans ITC](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052417/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/legacy-sans)...
Thats close. Is the and symbol from a different font?

I'm now positive, thanks to a [better sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052417/http:/www.presseportal.de/bild/58622-logo-pressemitteilung-scholz-friends-group-gmbh.jpg), that's surely Legacy Sans. The ampersand is definitely something else (Legacy one [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052417/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/legacy-sans/std-book/glyphs.html#glyphs/539149/7)). Looks like they played with a / [t](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052417/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/legacy-sans/std-book/glyphs.html#glyphs/539149/85) and a mirrored / [3](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052417/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/legacy-sans/std-book/glyphs.html#glyphs/539149/20)...
